intro: Maytenus paraguariensis var. genuina, commonly known as yerba mate, is a shrub or small tree native to South America, particularly Paraguay and northern Argentina. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds, and it is often cultivated for its stimulating leaves, which are used to prepare a traditional infusion. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to the humid, subtropical climates of its native range.
